018package org.tquadrat.foundation.util;
019
020import static java.lang.Integer.signum;
021import static java.lang.String.CASE_INSENSITIVE_ORDER;
022import static java.util.Comparator.naturalOrder;
023import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
024import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
025
026import java.util.Comparator;
027import java.util.List;
028
029import org.apiguardian.api.API;
030import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
031import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.UtilityClass;
032import org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError;
033import org.tquadrat.foundation.util.internal.KeyBasedComparator;
034import org.tquadrat.foundation.util.internal.ListBasedComparator;
035
036/**
037 *  This class provides factory methods for a bunch of different
038 *  implementations of
039 *  {@link Comparator}.
040 *
041 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
042 *  @version $Id: Comparators.java 980 2022-01-06 15:29:19Z tquadrat $
043 *  @since 0.0.5
044 *
045 *  @UMLGraph.link
046 */
047@UtilityClass
048@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: Comparators.java 980 2022-01-06 15:29:19Z tquadrat $" )
049@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
050public final class Comparators
051{
052        /*---------------*\
053    ====** Inner Classes **====================================================
054        \*---------------*/
055    /**
056     *  <p>{@summary Implementations of this interface provides the sort order
057     *  key from the given instance of the type.}</p>
058     *  <p>Usually the implementation of
059     *  {@link #getKey(Object) getKey()}
060     *  must ensure that the returned keys are distinct for distinct arguments.
061     *  This means for the arguments {@code a1} and {@code a2}, and the
062     *  generated keys <code>k<sub>a1</sub></code> and
063     *  <code>k<sub>a2</sub></code> that the following must be both
064     *  {@code true}:</p>
065     *  <ul>
066     *      <li><code>a1&nbsp;=&nbsp;a2&nbsp;&#x21d4;&nbsp;k<sub>a1</sub>&nbsp;=&nbsp;k<sub>a2</sub></code></li>
067     *      <li><code>a1&nbsp;&#x2260;&nbsp;a2&nbsp;&#x21d4;&nbsp;k<sub>a1</sub>&nbsp;&#x2260;&nbsp;k<sub>a2</sub></code></li>
068     *  </ul>
069     *  <p>This also requires that {@code getKey()} for the same argument must
070     *  provide always the same key.</p>
071     *
072     *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
073     *  @version $Id: Comparators.java 980 2022-01-06 15:29:19Z tquadrat $
074     *  @since 0.0.5
075     *
076     *  @param  <T> The type to order.
077     *  @param  <K> The key type that is used to determine the order; this may
078     *      be the same as the type itself.
079     *
080     *  @UMLGraph.link
081     */
082    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
083    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: Comparators.java 980 2022-01-06 15:29:19Z tquadrat $" )
084    @FunctionalInterface
085    public interface KeyProvider<T,K>
086    {
087            /*---------*\
088        ====** Methods **======================================================
089            \*---------*/
090        /**
091         *  Returns the sort order key for the given instance.
092         *
093         *  @param  instance    The instance; may be {@code null}.
094         *  @return The respective sort order key; will be {@code null} if
095         *      the {@code instance} was {@code null}.
096         */
097        public K getKey( T instance );
098    }
099    //  interface KeyProvider
100
101        /*--------------*\
102    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
103        \*--------------*/
104    /**
105     *  No instance allowed for this class.
106     */
107    private Comparators() { throw new PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError( Comparators.class ); }
108
109        /*---------*\
110    ====** Methods **==========================================================
111        \*---------*/
112    /**
113     *  Returns a comparator that compares Strings ignoring the case.<br>
114     *  <br>Internally this is
115     *  {@link String#CASE_INSENSITIVE_ORDER},
116     *  with the limitations described there.
117     *
118     *  @return The comparator.
119     */
120    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
121    public static final Comparator<String> caseInsensitiveComparator() { return CASE_INSENSITIVE_ORDER; }
122
123    /**
124     *  Returns a dummy comparator for elements that implements
125     *  {@link Comparable}.
126     *  Use this comparator if a
127     *  {@link Comparator}
128     *  is required for some reason, but your objects can be compared already
129     *  directly by their inherent
130     *  {@link Comparable#compareTo(Object)}
131     *  method.<br>
132     *  <br>A
133     *  {@link NullPointerException}
134     *  (and not a
135     *  {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.NullArgumentException})
136     *  is thrown, if the first argument is {@code null}. Whether an exception
137     *  is thrown when the second argument is {@code null} depends on the
138     *  implementation of
139     *  {@link Comparable#compareTo(Object) T.compareTo(Object)}.
140     *
141     *  @param  <T> The type to compare.
142     *  @return The comparator.
143     *
144     *  @see Comparator#naturalOrder()
145     *
146     *  @deprecated Use
147     *      {@link Comparator#naturalOrder()}
148     *      instead.
149     */
150    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
151    @Deprecated( since = "0.1.0", forRemoval = true )
152    public static final <T extends Comparable<? super T>> Comparator<T> comparableComparator()
153    {
154        final Comparator<T> retValue = naturalOrder();
155
156        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
157        return retValue;
158    }   //  comparableComparator()
159
160    /**
161     *  Returns a comparator that generates a sort key from the elements before
162     *  sorting them.<br>
163     *  <br>The implementation of this comparator generates the sort keys for
164     *  each and every comparison. This is obviously not very efficient. A more
165     *  efficient implementation is provided by
166     *  {@link #keyBasedComparator(KeyProvider, Comparator, boolean)}
167     *
168     *  @param  <T> The type to compare.
169     *  @param  <K> The key type that is used to determine the order; this may
170     *      be the same as the type itself.
171     *  @param  keyProvider The method that generates the sort key.
172     *  @return The comparator.
173     *
174     *  @note The key provider must return {@code null} for a {@code null}
175     *      value, as described for
176     *      {@link KeyProvider#getKey(Object)}.
177     *
178     *  @see KeyProvider
179     */
180    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
181    public static final <T, K extends Comparable<K>> Comparator<T> keyBasedComparator( final KeyProvider<? super T, K> keyProvider )
182    {
183        requireNonNullArgument( keyProvider, "keyProvider" );
184        final var retValue = (Comparator<T>) ( o1, o2) -> signum( keyProvider.getKey( o1 ).compareTo( keyProvider.getKey( o2 ) ) );
185
186        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
187        return retValue;
188    }   //  keyBasedComparator()
189
190    /**
191     *  A comparator that generates a sort key from the elements before sorting
192     *  them.<br>
193     *  <br>As it is not very efficient to generate the sort keys for each and
194     *  every comparison, it is possible to cache them.
195     *
196     *  @param  <T> The type to compare.
197     *  @param  <K> The key type that is used to determine the order; this may
198     *      be the same as the type itself.
199     *  @param  keyProvider The method that generates the sort key.
200     *  @param  keyComparator   The comparator that determines the order for
201     *      the keys.
202     *  @param  cacheKeys   A flag that determines whether the keys are to be
203     *      cached internally; {@code true} means they are kept, {@code false}
204     *      means that the keys are generated newly for each comparison.
205     *  @return The comparator.
206     *
207     *  @note The key provider must return {@code null} for a {@code null}
208     *      value, as described for
209     *      {@link KeyProvider#getKey(Object)}.
210     *  @note The internally used cache will be kept for later uses of the
211     *      comparator; this means that the key provider may not change its
212     *      behaviour meanwhile.
213     *  @note The internal cache is based on an
214     *      {@link java.util.IdentityHashMap IdentityHashMap}
215     *      with instances of the argument type <code>&lt;T&gt;</code> as the
216     *      key. If the key generation through the key provider will provide
217     *      equal keys for non-identical, but otherwise equal arguments, the
218     *      cache may not be efficient.
219     *
220     *  @see KeyProvider
221     */
222    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
223    public static final <T, K> Comparator<T> keyBasedComparator( final KeyProvider<T,K> keyProvider, final Comparator<K> keyComparator, final boolean cacheKeys )
224    {
225        return new KeyBasedComparator<>( keyProvider, keyComparator, cacheKeys );
226    }   //  keyBasedComparator()
227
228    /**
229     *  Sometimes a special sort order is required that cannot be defined as a
230     *  rule. Instead, a list defines the sequence. This method creates a new
231     *  {@link Comparator}
232     *  instance that works on the given list of keys. Values that are not on
233     *  that list will be placed to the end, ordered according to their natural
234     *  order if they or their keys implement the
235     *  {@link Comparable}
236     *  interface, or without any specific order.
237     *
238     *  @param  <T> The type to compare.
239     *  @param  <K> The key type that is used to determine the order; this may
240     *      be the same as the type itself.
241     *  @param  keys    The sort order keys.
242     *  @return The comparator.
243     */
244    @SafeVarargs
245    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
246    public static final <T,K> Comparator<T> listBasedComparator( final K... keys ) { return new ListBasedComparator<>( keys ); }
247
248    /**
249     *  Sometimes a special sort order is required that cannot be defined as a
250     *  rule. Instead, a list defines the sequence. This method creates a new
251     *  {@link Comparator}
252     *  instance that works on the given list of keys. Values that are not on
253     *  that list will be placed to the end, ordered according to their natural
254     *  order if they or their keys implement the
255     *  {@link Comparable}
256     *  interface, or without any specific order.
257     *
258     *  @param  <T> The type to compare.
259     *  @param  <K> The key type that is used to determine the order; this may
260     *      be the same as the type itself.
261     *  @param  keys    The sort order keys.
262     *  @return The comparator.
263     */
264    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
265    public static final <T,K> Comparator<T> listBasedComparator( final List<K> keys ) { return new ListBasedComparator<>( keys ); }
266
267    /**
268     *  Sometimes a special sort order is required that cannot be defined as a
269     *  rule. Instead, a list defines the sequence. This method creates a new
270     *  {@link Comparator}
271     *  instance that works on the given list of keys.
272     *
273     *  @param  <T> The type to compare.
274     *  @param  <K> The key type that is used to determine the order; this may
275     *      be the same as the type itself.
276     *  @param  keyProvider The implementation of
277     *      {@link Comparators.KeyProvider}
278     *      that returns the sort keys for the instances to compare.
279     *  @param  comparator  The comparator that is used to order the instances
280     *      that are not listed; if {@code null}, those are ordered randomly in
281     *      a non-consistent way if they or their keys do not implement the
282     *      {@link Comparable}
283     *      interface.
284     *  @param  keys    The sort order keys.
285     *  @return The comparator.
286     */
287    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
288    public static final <T,K> Comparator<T> listBasedComparator( final KeyProvider<T,K> keyProvider, final Comparator<? super T> comparator, final List<K> keys )
289    {
290        return new ListBasedComparator<>( keyProvider, comparator, keys );
291    }   //  listBasedComparator()
292
293    /**
294     *  Sometimes a special sort order is required that cannot be defined as a
295     *  rule. Instead, a list defines the sequence. This method creates a new
296     *  {@link Comparator}
297     *  instance that works on the given list of keys.
298     *
299     *  @param  <T> The type to compare.
300     *  @param  <K> The key type that is used to determine the order; this may
301     *      be the same as the type itself.
302     *  @param  keyProvider The implementation of
303     *      {@link org.tquadrat.foundation.util.Comparators.KeyProvider}
304     *      that returns the sort keys for the instances to compare.
305     *  @param  comparator  The comparator that is used to order the instances
306     *      that are not listed; if {@code null}, those are ordered randomly in
307     *      a non-consistent way if they or their keys do not implement the
308     *      {@link Comparable}
309     *      interface.
310     *  @param  keys    The sort order keys.
311     *  @return The comparator.
312     */
313    @SafeVarargs
314    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
315    public static final <T,K> Comparator<T> listBasedComparator( final KeyProvider<T, ? super K> keyProvider, final Comparator<? super T> comparator, final K... keys )
316    {
317        return new ListBasedComparator<>( keyProvider, comparator, keys );
318    }   //  ListBasedComparator()
319
320    /**
321     *  A comparator for numeric values.
322     *
323     *  @param  <T> The type to compare.
324     *  @return The comparator.
325     *
326     *  @since 0.1.0
327     */
328    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
329    public static final <T extends Number> Comparator<T> numberComparator()
330    {
331        final var retValue = (Comparator<T>) ( v1, v2) ->
332        {
333            if( v1 instanceof Comparable comparable )
334            {
335                @SuppressWarnings( "unchecked" )
336                final var result = signum( comparable.compareTo( v2 ) );
337                return result;
338            }
339            return (int) Math.signum( v1.doubleValue() - v2.doubleValue() );
340        };
341
342        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
343        return retValue;
344    }   //  numberComparator()
345}
346//  class Comparators
347
348/*
349 *  End of File
350 */
